new_src_summary: 本文段主要围绕卷毛这只狗与主人南风及朋友方召的日常互动，展现了他们之间深厚的情感。南风在确认房子没有大问题后，计划与房产中介和原屋主进行后续谈判，而卷毛则在海边玩得很开心，享受游泳和玩沙子的乐趣，体现出对未来新家的期待和对海洋的美好印象。方召与卷毛的对话进一步突显了卷毛的快乐和兴奋，同时引入了学习和海洋保护的主题。他担心卷毛在海洋中捕食濒危动物可能对生态造成破坏，尤其是在未来搬到新家后卷毛将有更多机会接触海洋。方召提到卷毛的学习能力和记忆力，使其在考试中容易取得好成绩，但希望卷毛在享受海洋的同时，能够理解保护海洋生态的重要性。此外，南风与方召的对话反映了他们的工作与生活状态，南风提到网上关于威尔的画展，方召对此有所了解。与此同时，文中还提到威尔在结业画展后因其作品《邻居家的狗》引发的热议。威尔完成了进修计划，短期目标是画方召，长期目标是画方召的狗。《邻居家的狗》是威尔耗时最长、最满意的作品，尽管其风格与之前的《我的邻居》相似，但更加难以理解，引发了观众的困惑与不安。网上对这幅画的讨论热烈，评论中有人认为威尔的创作超出了常人的理解范围，甚至调侃他可能对狗有心理阴影。整体上，文段风格轻松幽默，语气温暖亲切，融入了调侃与期待，体现了教育、环境保护与艺术评论的主题。
new_tgt_summary: In Chapter 449, Nanfeng decides to purchase a house after an inspection reveals no major issues, entrusting the details to the real estate agent and the original homeowner. Meanwhile, Curly, the dog, enjoys a beach day but is reluctant to leave, gazing longingly out of the car window. Nanfeng reassures Curly that he will be able to enjoy the beach daily once they move in, envisioning a happy life filled with fun and seafood. Upon returning to the graduate student dormitory, Curly is greeted by Fang Zhao, who confirms his enjoyable day at the beach and presents Curly with a study device containing a new folder of twenty e-books on marine environmental protection and management, along with test sets. Fang Zhao encourages Curly to complete the readings and achieve full marks on the tests within fifteen days, implying that this will allow him more beach time. He expresses concern about Curly's potential impact on the local marine ecosystem, worrying he might eat endangered species, though Curly has not overindulged due to Fang Zhao's supervision. Nanfeng later visits Fang Zhao to discuss renovations for the new house and notices Curly looking sad. They also discuss online discussions regarding Fang Zhao, who is focused on his thesis and has set his communication device to Do Not Disturb. Additionally, they talk about Wei Er's recent art exhibition, which has sparked significant online debate, especially regarding his piece titled "The Dog Next Door." This painting, more abstract and difficult to interpret than his previous work, has drawn mixed reactions due to its vibrant yet mysterious colors, prompting discussions about Wei Er's unconventional artistic expression and the unsettling nature of his portrayal of Fang Zhao's dog.

new_src_summary: 本文段围绕卷毛这只狗与主人南风及朋友方召的日常互动，展现了他们之间深厚的情感。南风在确认房子没有大问题后，计划与房产中介和原屋主进行后续谈判，而卷毛则在海边玩得很开心，享受游泳和玩沙子的乐趣，体现出对未来新家的期待和对海洋的美好印象。方召与卷毛的对话进一步突显了卷毛的快乐和兴奋，同时引入了学习和海洋保护的主题。他担心卷毛在海洋中捕食濒危动物可能对生态造成破坏，尤其是在未来搬到新家后卷毛将有更多机会接触海洋。方召提到卷毛的学习能力和记忆力，使其在考试中容易取得好成绩，但希望卷毛在享受海洋的同时，能够理解保护海洋生态的重要性。此外，南风与方召的对话反映了他们的工作与生活状态，南风提到网上关于威尔的画展，方召对此有所了解。与此同时，文中提到威尔在结业画展后因其作品《邻居家的狗》引发的热议。威尔完成了进修计划，短期目标是画方召，长期目标是画方召的狗。《邻居家的狗》是威尔耗时最长、最满意的作品，尽管其风格与之前的《我的邻居》相似，但更加难以理解，引发了观众的困惑与不安。网上对这幅画的讨论热烈，评论中有人认为威尔的创作超出了常人的理解范围，甚至调侃他可能对狗有心理阴影。威尔的画作在校网展示后迅速引起了收藏家的关注，并最终被一位来自牧洲的收藏家高价购买。这位收藏家强调，他购买画作不仅是看中威尔这个年轻艺术家，更是看重画作本身和其中的狗。文中还提到社会对牧洲人对狗的狂热反应以及由此引发的热议，威尔的画作因此登上热搜，成为公众关注的焦点。整体上，文段风格轻松幽默，语气温暖亲切，融入了调侃与期待，体现了教育、环境保护与艺术评论的主题。
new_tgt_summary: In Chapter 449, Nanfeng decides to purchase a house after a successful inspection, entrusting the details to the real estate agent and the original homeowner. Curly, the dog, enjoys a beach day but is reluctant to leave, gazing longingly out of the car window. Nanfeng reassures Curly that he will be able to enjoy the beach daily once they move in, envisioning a happy life filled with fun and seafood. Upon returning to the graduate student dormitory, Curly is greeted by Fang Zhao, who confirms his enjoyable day at the beach and presents him with a study device containing twenty e-books on marine environmental protection and management, along with test sets. Fang Zhao encourages Curly to complete the readings and achieve full marks on the tests within fifteen days, implying this will allow him more beach time. He expresses concern about Curly's potential impact on the local marine ecosystem, worried he might eat endangered species, though Curly has not overindulged due to Fang Zhao's supervision. Nanfeng later visits Fang Zhao to discuss renovations for the new house and notices Curly looking sad. They also discuss online discussions regarding Fang Zhao, who is focused on his thesis and has set his communication device to Do Not Disturb. Additionally, they talk about Wei Er's recent art exhibition, which has sparked significant online debate, especially regarding his piece titled "The Dog Next Door." This painting, more abstract and difficult to interpret than his previous work, has drawn mixed reactions due to its vibrant yet mysterious colors, prompting discussions about Wei Er's unconventional artistic expression and the unsettling nature of his portrayal of Fang Zhao's dog. The painting has garnered attention and was purchased at a high price by a collector from Muzhou, who views the investment as not just in the art but in Wei Er himself. This enthusiasm has sparked debates about the collector's motivations and the peculiar obsession of the people of Muzhou with dogs. An interview with the collector suggests the painting's value will rise significantly in the future, and it has trended on social media, prompting Fang Zhao to advise Curly to stay indoors for a while due to the attention.
